intro: Decaspermum microphyllum, commonly known as the small-leaved decaspermum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the warmer months. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its visual appeal.
